Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that Pepe Le Pew was canceled from the sequel to "Space Jam" because of the New York Times op-ed.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Pepe Le Pew was canceled due to the op-ed's accusation of normalizing rape culture, without providing concrete evidence or official statements from Warner Bros.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the decision to cut Pepe Le Pew from the sequel was made before the "cancel culture" controversy and was unrelated to the New York Times op-ed.
Understate: The claim may understate the reasons behind the decision to cut Pepe Le Pew, as it fails to mention the change in directors and the reported elimination of the character from the sequel well before the controversy.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by not providing a clear timeline of when the character was cut and why the decision was made, as well as not receiving a response from Warner Bros. for clarification.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation could be that the decision to cut Pepe Le Pew was made due to creative choices, changes in the storyline, or other factors not related to the New York Times op-ed.
